main

Class StringProcessing

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.StringProcessing

  • public class StringProcessing
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that stores a string as an instance variable and has many useful methods for manipulating the string. Important note: You may NOT use any methods from class String for this problem except length(), charAt(int i) and toLowerCase(). You may not use any methods from class Character, except for Character.isUpperCase. No credit will be given for solutions using other methods of class String.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsCharacter(char ch)
      Returns true if string s contains a given character and false otherwise
      boolean equal(java.lang.String otherString, boolean isCaseSensitive)
      Compares string stored in this object with another string that is passed as a parameter to the method.
      java.lang.String getReversedString()
      Return a reverse of the string Example: if an object stores "hello", when we call this method, it will return "olleh".
      java.lang.String getString()
      Getter for the string
      java.lang.String getStringWithoutWhiteSpaces()
      The method returns a new string that is just like the original string, but without white spaces.
      boolean isUppercase()
      Returns true if ALL the characters in the String are uppercase.

      Setter for the string
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string that is an instance variable of the class.

        public boolean isUppercase()

        true if all characters uppercase, otherwise false

      • equal

        public boolean equal(java.lang.String otherString,
                     boolean isCaseSensitive)
        Compares string stored in this object with another string that is passed as a parameter to the method. Compares strings character by character, and returns true if equal.
        Parameters:
        otherString - a string to compare "our" string to
        isCaseSensitive - true if comparison should be case sensitive, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if string are equals, false otherwise

        string without white spaces
